intro: Capsicophysalis potosina, commonly known as the Potosí nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, egg-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, and it produces berries that contain toxic alkaloids. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
